pullRequest.body:
- change the condition of `CharP.neg_one_pow_char` and `CharP.neg_one_pow_char_pow` from `CommRing` to `Ring`
- add `ExpChar.exists`, `expChar_of_injective_algebraMap`
- add `add_pow_expChar` and 9 similar functions parallel to that of `CharP`
- add `{charP|charZero|expChar}_of_injective_ringHom`

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7205246848/job/19627954034)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7205246848/job/19627953898)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7205246848/job/19627953780)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks ðŸŽ‰ 
maintainer merge

Thanks ðŸŽ‰ 
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Maybe add a `RingHom` version too?
Maybe, but we don't have `RingHom` version for `CharP` and `CharZero` either, so we should add all of them.

I add `{charP|charZero|expChar}_of_injective_ringHom`. ~~Seems that the original `algebraMap` version becomes useless, since both versions accept the same input argument `h : Function.Injective ...`, so `..._of_injective_algebraMap h` can be changed directly to `..._of_injective_ringHom h`.~~ No, the original version is still useful for `..._of_injective_algebraMap (by ...)` which allows type guessing.
Thanks!
Usually we write [IsDomain R] because these are equivalent in a Ring.
I see. I just copied the conditions for `CharP.char_is_prime_of_pos` ðŸ¤£

Neg, Inv, Div (for DivisionRing/Field) lemmas are missing but they are also missing for CharP, so maybe don't add them for now. We should also consider redefining [frobenius](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#frobenius) using ExpChar; I think getting rid of `Fact p.prime` is definitely nice.

> Neg, Inv, Div (for DivisionRing/Field) lemmas are missing but they are also missing for CharP, so maybe don't add them for now.

For `Neg` it is a corollary of `neg_one_pow_expChar` and `neg_one_pow_expChar_pow`. For `Inv` do you mean `(x^{-1})^q=(x^q)^{-1}`? I think it's true independent of the characteristic, so probably it's in an earlier file.

Indeed there's already [pow_inv_commâ‚€](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/GroupWithZero/Power.html#pow_inv_comm%E2%82%80). Sub is (can be) a corollary of Add and Neg, Neg is a corollary of Mul and Neg_one, and Div is a corollary of Mul and Inv, but they all can be useful. But they are not strictly necessary as we can just [`rw [frobenius_def]`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#frobenius_def) and use the RingHom lemmas ([map_divâ‚€](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/GroupWithZero/Units/Lemmas.html#map_div%E2%82%80) etc. already exists).

We also have [iterate_frobenius](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#iterate_frobenius) but the problem problem is that Lean won't recognize `(frobenius R p)^[n]` as a RingHom, so we'd need to introduce a `iterate_frobenius` (or `frobenius_pow`?) RingHom if we want to get rid of these lemmas.

The point is that in the application it is written directly as `x ^ (q ^ n)` if `q` is the exponential character, for example:
```lean
/-- A field extension `E / F` of exponential characteristic `q` is purely inseparable
if and only if for every element `x` of `E`, there exists a natural number `n` such that
`x ^ (q ^ n)` is contained in `F`. -/
theorem isPurelyInseparable_iff_mem_pow (q : â„•) [hF : ExpChar F q] :
    IsPurelyInseparable F E â†” âˆ€ x : E, âˆƒ n : â„•, x ^ (q ^ n) âˆˆ (algebraMap F E).range := by ...
```
It's written directly as `x ^ (q ^ n)` without using `frobenius` :-/
Does R need to be commutative? (three occurrences total)
No ðŸ˜‚

Should we remove these parentheses? They don't show up in the online docs anyway, and they are not there in the CharP versions.
```suggestion
    {n : â„•} (x y : R) (h : Commute x y) : (x + y) ^ q ^ n = x ^ q ^ n + y ^ q ^ n := by
```

> and they are not there in the CharP versions.

OK, I'll remove them.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/CharP/ExpChar): add some results parallel to `CharP`
